image.altText: A bright orange bushfire rages through bushland at twilight.

props.synopsis: The Tasmania Fire Service confirms 19 homes have been claimed by a bushfire that ripped through Dolphin Sands this week, while nearly 200 assets have been damaged.

title.children: 19 homes lost and dozens damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire in Tasmania, authorities confirm

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking.

props.synopsis: The furore over Communications Minister Anika Wells's expenses continues, with just three days until the government's much-anticipated social media ban for under 16s comes into force.

title.children: PM's office approved almost $100k in flights for communications minister

image.altText: Netflix will have access to the storied Hollywood studio's vast catalogue of films and TV shows.

props.synopsis: A major deal between Netflix and Warner Bros has sent shock waves through Hollywood and sparked backlash.

title.children: Why Hollywood has called the Netflix-Warner Bros merger a disaster

image.altText: Australia batter Travis Head watches the ball race away after a shot at the Gabba.

props.synopsis: Captain Steve Smith's moment of magic kicks off an English collapse of 4-17, giving Australia small chase of 65 runs to win the second Ashes Test at the Gabba. Follow live.

title.children: Australia chasing 65 to win after Smith stunner sparks England collapse

image.altText: Trump furrows his brow as he enunciates a word, staring directly into a camera

props.synopsis: A Republican claimed a win at a by-election in Tennessee this week, but his party colleagues are sounding alarm bells.

title.children: This Tennessee election has set off alarm among Trump's Republicans

image.altText: Two people wearing black t-shirts stand next to a glass cabinet with smears of food on it

props.synopsis: An organisation called Take Back Power, which describes itself as a civil resistance group, posted footage of the incident on social media and said two of its members had smothered the Imperial State Crown display case with apple crumble and custard.

title.children: Four arrested in London after apple crumble thrown at Crown Jewels display

image.altText: Two people dressed in blue protective gear carrying out a stretcher with a body on it covered in a white sheet.

props.synopsis: Gunmen stormed a hostel in the early hours of the morning, shooting 25 people at the scene and killing at least 11 people, including three children.

title.children: At least 11 killed in South Africa hostel shooting

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: This rare photo captures the 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: Pro-choice protesters dressed as handmaidens outside the US Capitol

props.synopsis: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

title.children: 'This was a wanted pregnancy': The mothers facing prosecution in Trump's America

image.altText: A police car and police tape on a busy street.

props.synopsis: Police are seeking out witnesses and searching for a second person believed to be involved in the fatal stabbing of a man in Melbourne's north.

title.children: Teenager arrested, police searching for second person after fatal stabbing

image.altText: A high shot of beach cabanas set up near the water at Noosa beach

props.synopsis: First responders say they are having to live well outside their operating regions due to lack of available housing.

title.children: First responders struggling to find homes in tourism hotspot

image.altText: A women with grey hair smiling over to her left, holding a certificate and a bunch of flowers.

props.synopsis: Maisie Harkin was born on country in Western Australia's Great Victoria Desert. It has taken 88 years for her birth to be officially recognised.

title.children: After 88 years, Maisie 'feels like a somebody' after getting her birth certificate

image.altText: A smash windscreen of an ambulance. Blood on glass and ambulance bonnet.

props.synopsis: A video circulated on social media shows a naked male using his head to smash the windscreen of a moving ambulance.

title.children: Naked man smashes ambulance windscreen in Kalgoorlie-Boulder

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a green jacket with looking stern

props.synopsis: South Australian Liberal frontbencher Ashton Hurn will run for her party's leadership, following the shock resignation of Vincent Tarzia just months out from the next state election.

title.children: Ashton Hurn to run for SA Liberal leadership following Tarzia departure

image.altText: Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen of Denmark poses with the Stonehaven Cup after winning Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Cameron Smith falls agonisingly short of winning his first Australian Open, as Denmark's Rasmus Neergaard-Petersen scores a thrilling one-stroke victory at Royal Melbourne.

title.children: Smith denied first Australian Open title as Dane claims tense win

image.altText: The top three F1 drivers in qualifying stand on the podium, with (left to right) Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri warns he's not out of the Formula One title hunt yet, even if many only now have eyes on a Lando Norris-Max Verstappen duel for the crown.

title.children: 'I've got a chance': Piastri won't rule out F1 boilover despite tough qualifying

image.altText: A group of young people toast over a meal holding glasses of limoncello.

props.synopsis: South Australian distillers are tapping into a growing global thirst for limoncello and finding a new market for lemons and grape spirit.

title.children: The sweet spirit 'steeped in tradition' that's becoming trendy

image.altText: Packages of seized cocaine wrapped up and displayed at an AFP press conference.

props.synopsis: The alleged use of an international livestock ship to smuggle drugs into Western Australia last month prompted a media storm, but one expert says it is just one among a "dizzying variety" of methods criminals are trying.

title.children: 'Motherships', corpses and 'comical' failures as drug smugglers try it all

image.altText: A forest with vines and ferns on the ground and paperbark trees

props.synopsis: Bush Heritage Australia says it is still considering how to safely reopen the walk, which prior to closure was being visited by 100,000 people a year.

title.children: Beloved by Instagrammers, walk closed to preserve paperbark forest

image.altText: A badly smashed black sedan car in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy is alleged to have been the driver of a car which crashed into a pole early Sunday, killing a 17-year-old passenger.

title.children: Teenager charged after passenger killed in early morning crash

image.altText: A photo of Adam Watts in police uniform smiling alongside a  photo of a NSW Police logo.

props.synopsis: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

title.children: Officer's mental health questioned by insurance doctor he'd never met

image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old prisoner was so badly bashed at an Adelaide jail on Sunday morning that he was left "barely recognisable" and had to be rushed to hospital for treatment, a union says.

title.children: Prisoner 'barely recognisable' after alleged assault at SA jail, union says

image.altText: A white seagull with orange beak and legs, grey wings and black tail stands on bitumen.

props.synopsis: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

title.children: Dog patrols at Federation Square to curb 'terrifying' seagull swooping

image.altText: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul

props.synopsis: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

title.children: A new storm is brewing in South-East Asia. This time it's in the halls of power

image.altText: A female's hands operate a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

title.children: Parents could grant Labor the grace the opposition won't on social media ban

image.altText: Underwater Rugby players

props.synopsis: As temperatures soar, advocates of public pools in Canberra say they want to see greater support and investment for facilities in the national capital.

title.children: 'Trend is they're going': Concerns for the future of Canberra's public pools

image.altText: A display monitor on the handlebars of an e-bike

props.synopsis: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

title.children: A Christmas warning for parents thinking of buying an e-bike

image.altText: a gurney is seen inside a green tiled cell through a barred window

props.synopsis: On this day in history, the US carried out its first execution by lethal injection — a method thought up by one doctor.

title.children: At 32, this doctor was tasked with finding a 'humane' way to kill people

image.altText: A patron peruses art in a gallery.

props.synopsis: More than three years after a Tasmanian council green-lit a plan to ease the financial burden of the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery, stakeholders worry momentum has stalled.

title.children: 'Treasured' gallery that costs ratepayers millions faces a problem

image.altText: A burnt out car, with destroyed and damaged buildings visible behind it

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

title.children: Why the small city of Pokrovsk means so much to Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A Latina woman with long brown hair and a guide dog walking across a crowded crossing

props.synopsis: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

title.children: Jael is Deaf and blind. Here's how she goes about her day

image.altText: A man in a dark dry suit floating with his head above water in a pool, in scuba diving gear.

props.synopsis: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Fish returning to some parts of SA's coast, divers say

image.altText: Sixers players celebrate after winning a WBBL match

props.synopsis: Ellyse Perry produced one of the best knocks of her career but the Sydney Sixers took until the final ball to see off the Adelaide Strikers and land a WBBL finals spot.

title.children: Sixers down Strikers in final-ball thriller to secure WBBL finals berth

image.altText: New prep-aged children sit on floor in circle in prep classroom playing barrel of monkeys game at Spring Mountain State School.

props.synopsis: Parents had the opportunity to pore over NAPLAN results for their children's school this week, but interpreting the data may not have been clear at first glance.

title.children: Why you may want to take a closer look at a school's NAPLAN results
